Study Title: A Study of Cisplatin Plus Radiotherapy Compared to Cetuximab Plus Radiotherapy in Locally Advanced Head and Neck Cancer.
Brief Summary: The primary endpoint in this study is to investigate if there is a difference in overall survival in patients with locally advanced head and neck cancer, randomized to either radiotherapy and cetuximab or radiotherapy and cisplatin. A second randomization is performed in patients with T3-T4 tumors; allocated radiotherapy either 68.0 Gy or 73.1 Gy.
Conditions: Locally Advanced Head and Neck Cancer
Primary Outcome Measures: Overall survival, Every 3 month for 2 years, and every 6 month until 5 years for evaluation of overall survival
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: Gävle Hospital, Gävle, Sweden|Sahlgrenska University Hospital, Göteborg, Sweden|County Hospital Ryhov, Jönköping, Sweden|Central Hospital, Karlstad, Sweden|University Hospital Linköping, Linköping, Sweden|Karolinska Universityhospital, Stockholm, Sweden|Norrland University Hospital, Umeå, Sweden|Västmanlands Hospital Västerås, Västerås, Sweden|University Hospital Örebro, Örebro, Sweden
